intro: Zeuxine gracilis var. sakagutii, commonly known as the Sakaguchi's slender zeuxine, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy and often toxic species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, adapting to its cool, moist habitats. This variant is of particular interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
